title: The Lobster (2015)
explanation: The Lobster explores social segregation and xenophobia through its unique premise of single people being turned into animals, and the strict rules and rituals of the hotel that enforce conformity and partnership. The film also presents a contrasting society in the form of the loners, who have their own set of rules against romance. The plot revolves around David's experiences in both societies and his secret relationship with a woman who shares his distinguishing trait of shortsightedness, ultimately leading to a thought-provoking exploration of societal expectations and the lengths people will go to find connection and acceptance.
